channel.title: My Portfolio Design
channel.description:
I've been working on a portfolio design and I think it came out really nice. :) [img]http://i.gyazo.com/c4c77841faf7c504f8d6d4d62a7b3bb1.png[/img]
Any thoughts or suggestions? I'd love to improve on this more.

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:19, topic:543724”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=662603.msg4428943#msg4428943 date=1402269594]
John finally acquired an eye for design. Thank god… <3
[/quote]
Your standards for design are pretty low.[/quote]

Me having low design standards… Doesn’t sound likely.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Ah okay.

If he really wants to improve it, he needs to choose better colours and text. You should start making mockups in Photoshop first.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:21, topic:543724”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=662603.msg4429069#msg4429069 date=1402337565]

John finally acquired an eye for design. Thank god… <3

Your standards for design are pretty low.

Basing that on what?
[/quote]
Well assuming he’s talking about the image that was posted on thread, I personally wouldn’t say a really dull background colour and some dull coloured boxes + crappy text is good looking.[/quote]
It was more the improvement on what John had been making prior to this. Myself and RevengePK have followed John’s progress from him just learning so it’s quite a difference to what it is now. It’s better than most of the design I used to do, I could never visualise anything. I’d say well done to the kid, he’s getting somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:11, topic:543724”]Yeah, this would work out nicely also. Something like this would be cool.

http://starkweatherassociationservices.com/[/quote]
That is one really weird website. I would never make any of mine like that.

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:11, topic:543724”]http://starkweatherassociationservices.com/

(That’s the site for my company, or rather the company that I work for.)[/quote]

"We’ll show you how to improve operational efficiency"
Makes site 50x longer than it need to be

I’m just kidding with you it looks nice

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:11, topic:543724”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=662603.msg4428716#msg4428716 date=1402155667]

What amount of text are you going to fix in those boxes? o__O

Yeah, this is a good point too. I would recommend having each of these buttons take you to a new page for more information.
[/quote]Or, alternatively, put all the information on one page and link to each section via IDs so the page scrolls down.

Yeah, this would work out nicely also. Something like this would be cool.

http://starkweatherassociationservices.com/

(That’s the site for my company, or rather the company that I work for.)[/quote]A similar idea. This website is really, really awkward and has a lot of wasted space though.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Ambokile:

Facebook has an official colour. Using it will make your visitors associate it instantly

I don’t think he’s even planning to make it Facebook.

John:

The icons are from Font-Awesome, they’re just placeholders for the time being until I decide what to place in each box.

But you have a point, Facebook pretty much has a reserved color, haha.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“John, post:3, topic:543724”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=662603.msg4428646#msg4428646 date=1402102521]
Facebook should have a blue box color not that ugly ass pink.
[/quote]
Switched around the two colours, how’s this? :o
[/quote]

Facebook has an official colour. Using it will make your visitors associate it instantly

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I think it’s these two colors being similar and being diagonal from each other. I don’t have suggestions on rearranging them, but I would just move them around and try to find a good outcome.

And also, try and see what it looks like if you move the “hire me” button to after the paragraph, may come out better, not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

The icons are from Font-Awesome, they’re just placeholders for the time being until I decide what to place in each box.
As for the colours, I thought that they were a nice selection. Maybe the order of the colours looks a bit off?

Read full topic

item.title: My Portfolio Design
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

HcoJustin:

I love the idea behind it, but I think you need to narrow your color scheme slightly. I’m also a little confused about what the desktop button is for

I’m guessing it’s for remote assistance or something like TeamViewer, just a thought.

@OP: The design looks nice, but something with the colors looks weird… Not sure what.

Read full topic
